messages.subject: Re: F&K
messages.msgSnippet: Thank you both, Craig and Rich, Bob Benson mentioned that in that Meiji Taikan the mei was different than the one example. It  seems Craig has found the other
messages.messageBody:
Thank you both, Craig and Rich, Bob Benson mentioned that in that
Meiji Taikan the mei was different than the one example. It seems
Craig has found the other two. Thanks for the info. John ---
In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, Richard Turner <ikkanshi@w...>

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] F&K
messages.msgSnippet: John, Craig and all. I had a look in Toso Kodogu Meiji Taikan and Wakayama shows one example there. The kanji for both Guro and Mori are quite different. The
messages.messageBody:
John, Craig and all. I had a look in Toso Kodogu Meiji Taikan and
Wakayama shows one example there. The kanji for both Guro and Mori are
quite different. The Guro is well separated in all the strokes on John's
example and the the published mei is quite compact and tight.. The mori
is also think and tight in Wakayama's but on John's piece, quite wide.
Also the Kao looks a bit different as well.

So, after all that, not sure. Some of these guys changed their mei as
they aged, or matured.

Cheers

Rich

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] F&K
messages.msgSnippet: John, Haynes lists two Ishiguro Masamori that signed with these kanji, H 04225.0 and H 04227.0 - the first said to be a student of the first Ishiguro Masatsune
messages.messageBody:
John,

Haynes lists two Ishiguro Masamori that signed with these kanji, H
04225.0 and H 04227.0 - the first said to be a student of the first
Ishiguro Masatsune (H 04751.0) but an independent artist, but the
name was also used by the second Ishiguro Masatsune H 04752.0. The
second Masamori listing appears to be for a student of the second
Ishiguro Mastasune who died ca. 1800.

The photos are a bit blurry - or maybe it's my eyes - and I'm no
authority on the signature. There should be examples in Wakayama that
someone can look up, my copies are in the warehouse.


--
Craig Harris
Books from and about Asia
www.bridgeofdreams.com

messages.subject: F&K
messages.msgSnippet: Hi All, Could someone tell me more about Masamori of Ishiguro school. I m told there were three. Do any know which one this might be? Thanks, John link:
messages.messageBody:
Hi All, Could someone tell me more about Masamori of Ishiguro school.
I'm told there were three. Do any know which one this might be?
Thanks, John link: www.johnstuart.biz/new_page_10.htm bottom set
